Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text:
I would rate 3&1/2 stars ⭐️:

1 star ⭐️ is definitely given to the food. Especially the “Sunagimo confit”, a …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text:
Love the location. The skewers are extremely delicious, especially the Unagi, YOU MUST ORDER. The service is also top notch.
However, the Udon and Ramen we ordered is just average but pricy, not that …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: I love a good izakaya. Amsterdam has surprised me with this little gem. Been here twice and everything’s fantastic. Really love the wasabi yam as a drinking dish. Not cheap, but worth the price!

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Great cozy Japanese restaurant that actually brings out that authentic Japanese izakaya feeling. Pretty sure this is one of the best restaurants to experience real Japanese flavours and a Japanese atmosphere. Do not hesitate to try "odd" dishes like chicken skin or chicken heart as they are absolutely delicious! ごちそうさまでした！

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text:
Best grill kipmaggen I had in Netherlands. Just order all the grill skewers on the menu, none would disappoint you.
Kombucha and Yuzu beer must try!

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Great food and beatuful dishes, amazing and great, professional stuff! Perfect place, it's busy, but I can understand why! Super food!

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text:
Been here a few times now, and I just keep coming back.

I love all their dishes! Especially the chicken nanban was amazing. Very tender, …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Yakitori place but tonkotsu ramen was so good! I felt like back in japan :) staff was nice, good atmosphere. Yakitori is very good, but felt like little bit over price

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Fine dine prices without the experience. For 25 euro I got some overpriced fatty tuna samples, my girlfriend got 3 thin beef slices for 18 euro. If you charge these prices (by the side of the road, so not great location) then at least have …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Had a delicious dinner here. The ambience and staff were very nice. It can be quite expensive, but there are also a lot of cheaper dishes that looked amazing and seem to be quite filling, like a ramen dish. …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: It is an authentic Japanese restaurant with even the Menu written in Japanese with an English translation. The location is beautiful, with seating inside and outside. We took quite some time to order but the food came in quickly. The …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Amazing authentic Japanese izakaya! Loved every bite of it! But a bit over priced for not being a fine dinning and if you compare it to silimar izakayas in Japan.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: The best Izakaya style Japanese place in Amsterdam. Service can be a bit clunky, but the food is great and very tasty. The Ramen was ok, but then again you do not go to an Izakaya for the Ramen. All washed down with a good Asahi dry.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Love the location and restaurant, food was excellent, my dish was beef wagyu curry and my wife bowl wagyu beef

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Been here many times. Loved the grilled foods. Unfortunately the grilled dishes are far less tasty than before. I ordered 8 different dishes today only the Teba remained same old quality. Shiitake is okay. Teriyaki Irish beef, Negima, …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Blink twice and wonder yourself in Tokyo. Honestly, so far, this is the most authentic Japanese restaurant I have been outside of Japan. Taste is genuinely original and very flavourful—the perfect place for a casual dinner with friends. …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Absolutely authentic japanese taste and atmosphere, would highly recommend going here!

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Tried different dishes like ramen, rice, karage. The soup was separated from the ramen so if this is needed you can heat up by yourself at home. But overal the food is warm enough, after driving 25 minutes to my home. …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Really nice Japanese restaurant, with great food. Service took sometimes a bit of time, but the great taste of the food made totally up for that!

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text:
Great, tradition Japanese restaurant, tucked away right across the RAI.

With welcoming (mostly Japanese) staff, and incredible food. One of the few …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: I was looking forward to have dinner here, the food i had was good but quite pricey, and maybe was only tonight but the service was really messy, and way too many people standing waiting to be sestet, had to wait 20 min for a beer (asking …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: We went a year ago and highly rated the ramen. Went today and extremely disappointed - noodles were cheaper, broth weaker and came with hardly any additional bits and pieces in the soup. 36 euro for 2 soups, tea and water - poor.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Fantastic Japanese restaurant with a great choice of really the best dishes. We were amazed by the roasted eggplant topped with a great taste of miso. The staff is super friendly and can definitely advice you about the menu. And don't wear your new clothes! It's quite smokey inside

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Good food. First visit. First time we tasted fresh wasabi (amazing). You have to order via a paper sheet were you ticked the meal and the number you want. Typical Japanese grilled, scallops were tasteless. Quick service and personnel very …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: You are in Amsterdam but when you get inside you feel like you’re inside a restaurant in Japan. Authentic vibes & food, topped with good service. It is properly run to the delight of Japanese food enthusiasts. Keep up the good work Hakata Senpachi.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Very cosy & typical Japanese restaurant. Love the atmosphere & food.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text:
Tasty food, great atmosphere. Pick a seat at the bar in front of the kitchen.

Shitake mushrooms garlic oil and Yam with fresh wasabi were great, as the …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Great authentic taste with a great selection of filling mains and skewers. Great selection of japanese liquor as well. The inner section can be pretty smokey, so sit on the terras if there are eye or breathing sensitivity.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: After a long block down period, yesterday was the first time for I and my hubby to go out for a diner outside, and we decided to give us the first time to our most favorite Japanese restaurant--SENPACHI, we ordered a table in the terras at …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: 3.5 First of all...bring your own wasabi they charged 3euro for a small dish (like soysauce dish) and it was pretty tasteless...no wasabi kick at all. The yakitori was oretty good but i loved their ramen. Good and flavourful.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Really nice and tasty Japanese food! Didn’t expect they have also quite some options for vegetarians also in a Japanese kitchen, highly recommended to Japanese food lovers!

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: I come here often and they never dissappoint me. The service is good and the food is stunning. If you love Izakaya then you should definitely pay a visit here!

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text:
Hands down my favorite Japanese restaurant in Amsterdam.

Staff is friendly, fast and kind. …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: The fried chicken in sauce was decent! The ramen was also very tasty. I ordered cold soba as well. That one was a bit plain in taste but after adding the complimentary sauce the taste seemed ok.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: What is this place?! How can they serve such an authentic and tasty Japanese food in Europe?! It’s really magic. :D Now I don’t need to miss Japanese food anymore...because I can come back here any time. :)

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Service was friendly and fast. Ramen broth had no flavor and was fatty.  Kimchi was poorly flavored and watery. Gyoza lacked seasoning in the filling as well as the Tsukune.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text:
Very good Japanese Restaurant in Amsterdam.

We have been here several times. Once for dinner and many times for lunch. …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Location was easy to find. Not many options for lunch and quite expensive. Got charged for two orders of tea but was only one teapot. Staff was ok.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Great little Japanese restaurant. Soba was delicious and the yakitori from the grill is awesome here. Good prices and not too expensive. Staff was also very friendly and helpful.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Never been to Japan but the experience of this food made me travel a little. The eel and black ice cream are a must order! You are welcome ;-)

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Had lunch at the place. They do have lunch menu which is around ramen (Japanese noodle). Not so much variety while dinner menu seems to be more. Taste is authentic with my Asian tongue. Service lady was lovely. Also good for family with young kids. Will stop by from time to time for sure.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Real Japanese dish!!! You will see what is real Japanese foods. All dish are really amazing, staff are friendly,that why I went to here a lot of times.  I highly recommend this restaurant.I’m honest!!! I guess Everyone must try Real Japanese dish at Senpachi ;)

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Such a great Japanese restaurant. Their food is amazing and it feels pretty authentic. We’ve tried the ramen, the scallops, eggplant with miso and pork belly and chicken grilled sticks. Amazing! Expect ~25€ pp

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: There’s both positives and negatives about the restaurant, but unfortunately the negatives outweigh the positives by a huge margin. …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Meal was really delicious, would like to visit again

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: The best ramen in the Netherlands! Hakata Senpachi is one of my fave authentic Japanese restaurant in Amsterdam.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Nice grilled food! Noodles are a bit salty, kitchen is not separated from the dining place, sometimes it can get smoky.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Friends call me "1-Star Michael" because my reviews are always honest and not sugar coating if some things are wrong. Well here is one of my rare 4-star reviews. …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Great hibachi (charkoal grill) place! Took the foiegrois which was to die for. Tasty ramen to top it off.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Really good oldschool homestyle Japanese Restaurant. We had some skewers with chicken and chicken skin and it was perfectly grilled on charcoal, nice and tender, and the juices just dripped off. Also the gyozas and the Karaage were super …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text:
The food is good and tasty.

It is on the expensive side, but definitely worth to try once in a while. …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Good service, amazing food, loved how it looked inside & the vibe was so good. Really enjoyed & most definitely coming back!

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text:
One of the best ramens in town!!
The moment you step in , you are immediately taken to a Tokyo neighbourhood ramen place. Food is good , service is fast, ambience is smoky!!

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: The best Ramen in town. Chef Hiro san is a passionate talented and dedicated professional who brought the authentic Izakaya atmosphere (pub in japanese) to Amsterdam with a great sake selection and dishes. I highly recommend this place.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Forgot half of our orders. We were waiting without food like 1 hour at the terrace. Very overpriced - We paid 47euros for two, still not full and only drank 2 beers in total. Food tastes exactly the same if you do bbq at home with teriyaki …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: This place is like being in Japan. The environment is very similar and you could try a really good quality food and of course you will eat really special Japanese dishes. Very recommendable!

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Each of Yakitori is in decent level as well as chicken nanban(fried chicken with tartare source). Chicken nanban was a bigger portion than expected, I couldn’t reach ramen.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Really good yakitori. Wear cheap clothes, because you will smell like a bbq

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Very good quality ramen and gyoza. Good selection of drinks. Kind service.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Best and most authentic Japanese food I've had in Amsterdam. The tonkotsu smells and tastes like its been painstakingly boiled for days, and the pork is just sublime, well-marinated, ultra tender, with just the right amounts of fat in …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Not cheap, but the most authentic Japanese izakaya style place in Amsterdam!

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: It was really little for a main course. I'm used to Udon soup with a lot more filling. The soup tasted good though.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Food was delicious, but because they are making barbecue inside and have very bad ventilation it was difficult to breath there.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Plenty of choice for ramen and yakitori but really overpriced. Good selection of umeshu and sake. The place is a bit smokey inside but it gives a lot of atmosphere, raccomended

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text:
Super fresh, authentic and tasty food, with great service! A must try in Amsterdam!
Also had the salt and yuzu sake, delicious!

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Amazing place if you are fun of Japanese culture. Super atmosphere fully recommend

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Celebrated my boyfriend's birthday with his family. Authentic japanese meal with real time grilling in house! Lovely!

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Not only one of the best Japanese places in town, but one of the best restaurants altogether.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: An authentic Japanese restaurant. Litterally Every item On their menu is great.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Overall an amazing restaurant, their BBQ dishes are really good, good ramen, and their grilled mackarel is some of the best food I've ever had lol. The place is also well decorated and has a nice atmosphere, really feels like an "authentic" …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Service can be a bit sporadic at busy times but good food and atmosphere!

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Best yakitori restaurant in NL.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: This is friend chicken lunch set,tasty. They also offer Ramen and Grills (only in dinner).

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text:
Booked a table for 13:30 and the kitchen wasn’t ready at all, grilled dishes and sashimi weren’t available..
Good ramens and curry but don’t order the wagyu, the meat was hard to chew, I …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: A lovely authentic Japanese gem, with kind and helpful staff. Tastiest ramen I have tried in Amsterdam so far, with all the drink options I've been craving for. The yakitori I tried also fulfilled all the expectations. Great place :>

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Delicious food and drinks, but quite pricey. Service can be a bit slow (especially when busy, and it usually is), so you have to be quite patient.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Worst experience ever in a restaurant. Came with a reservation for two with a table inside. They had us waiting 30 minutes to sit us outside. Then they had us waiting another 30 minutes to order, and then they told us the grill was too busy and we couldnt order any food. Still had to pay for our two beers.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: So far I tried only the ramen and it was delicious. The service was good and the staff was friendly. I will definitely go back for some yakitori.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: No taste and very expensive. Only edame and gyozas were good.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: One of the best yakitori so far in EU

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: This is the most authentic Japanese restaurant I’ve been in Amsterdam! Can’t recommend it more 😍

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: This place ain’t cheap (in contrast to what it would probably be were you actually in Japan) but nonetheless, it’s as authentic as it gets: Amsterdam’s most authentic Japanese arguably.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Best Izakaya in town!!!Gyutan is my favorite!cold udon also nice, next time will try the Ramen

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Great food! Would definitely recommend!

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Really great food. I got kinda scared of the octopus balls tho (like meat balls but made of octopus) because the octopus flakes on it were still moving. Menu is a little hard to understand because I still only understood half of the English …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: We just had some food here, Ramen. The food was good. Could be a bit more hot (e.g. the 🥚 in my ramen). However, the staff was really good and they are taking this Covid-19 time very, very seriously. Everyone is wearing a 😷 and they are cleaning extremely well. I was really impressed. So thank you for that, guys. See you soon.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Great vibes, really good atmosphere, but food was mediocre. Edamame was microwaved I think, sashimi was pre-prepared hours before I think ... didn't seem that fresh and some of the pieces were a little chewy. Yakatori was a little …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Sometimes I hesitate sharing this place with people because I am afraid that everyone is going to flock there, realize how amazing it is and it would be a nightmare to get a table. :-P …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text:
This place has absolutely fantastic food. The grilled aubergine with fish flakes blew me away.
Do yourself a favor and try the fried chicken as well, both the marinated and …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Food seems fine, service is poor. Waitress and waiter were nice and attentive but kitchen was slow. It took around 90 minutes for all of our dishes to finally be served. A bit on the pricey side but nothing crazy. Although I might be back, …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text:
It was a great and authentic Japanese experience.

The food was absolutely tasty. They have a wide variety of food with excellent quality. Their sake selection was amazing and the employees were very kind.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Great izekaya experience in Amsterdam! Can get a bit pricey fast, but is well worth it. …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Food is really among the best Japanese in Amsterdam. Lots of choices from cheap to expensive. Staff was super friendly too. It's busy, but you won't have to wait long for your food at all.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Crowded place, but good atmosphere, seats at tables and along the kitchen counter. Quick and friendly staff, helpful. Very good and juicy kushiyaki of chicken (yakitori), beef, shiitake and pork belly (awesome, especially the miso). Three …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Their karaage chicken is very good. Ramen not so excellent, then again- it’s not their speciality. Will be trying the skewers next!

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Izakaya style atmosphere. Good selection of Japanese draft beers. Service is quick. Food is cooked to order. Highly recommend the yakitori(skewers) and seasonal menus. Ramen broths are also rich in flavor and probably the best tonkatsu ramen in Amsterdam. Walk ins discouraged- almost always booked at peak times.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Best Izakaya style Japanese authentic bar and restaurant. Every foods are top quality. Foie-gras with eel is tremendous.     Ramen also top quality.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: I only had ramen and some side dishes so I can not give an overall review but the Tonkotsu ramen featured yuzu flavor which I do not think it is typical in Hakata but it was very delicious. Service is not open for lunch during lunch time, …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: The website is in Japanese, the menu is in Japanese and the food... Japanese quality. Simply a great place. Don't wear your delicate dress, because your clothes will smell after a visit to this place.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Good service, great atmosphere and excellent food :) please do not leave without trying their unagi!

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text:
One of the best Japanese restaurants in Amsterdam! My cousin and his friend came here, upon returning from an long term exchange in Japan: they were really pleased!
Highly recommend

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Great experience. You're basically sitting next to the guy that prepares all the skewers on a little grill that you would see at a typical food stall. Not an average Japanese restaurant Hardly any seafood and no sushi, but delicious dishes …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: One of the best ramen and japenese cuisine restaurants I have ever been too. It's kind of a hidden gem but so good. Its expensive but worth it

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Overpriced and food came very slowly. The terrace looks cheap, not aligned with the prices. Food was good but not sure I'll go back.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Not your average sushi place! I am not Japanese, so can't vouch for authenticity; but certainly felt truly Japanese! Food awesome, great variety and unique tastes. Try the eggplant and tomato+ bacon.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Amazing ramen and super friendly staff, definitely recommend 👍

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Really delicious authentic japanese food! Because of the grill inside the restaurant, it smells a bit, but that was not a problem for us. The food and nice service was better than we expected :)

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Amazing Izakaya near RAI. Come with friends and order everything. All delicious!!

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Very good but the parking nearby is not so nice.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Top quality food! Since I've been once, it's been my favorite restaurant since! The nanban chicken and shoyu ramen are excellent!

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Don’t come here if you want to be full, the main dish is like the size of side dish - same thing different ways of grilling one is side dish another one is main dish. Also, we can’t breath due to the smoke (by grilling) in the restaurant and the waitresses either don’t understand English or with unfriendly attitude.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: This is EXACTLY like the kinda yakitori you will get in Japan. Shio salted flavours only. It was the best Japanese meal I have had in Europe all these years.. we also got sashimis and karage fried chicken too. My favourite (aside from the …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: After trying so many other ramen places in Amsterdam we always end up at Senpachi. It’s really the best in town!

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: We made a reservation for Valentine's day to have dinner with my family of 4. We did so 8 days before. They could not find our reservation. We showed them the phonecall we made to the restaurant on the 6th and they did believed us, that we …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Probably the best Japanese restaurant in Amsterdam. Really subtle combinations of flavors and great variety of sake. Very authentic.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: The deep fried aubergine with miso paste is amazing and the wagyu bowl was loved

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Just as if you are in a Izakaya in Japan! The food was delicious and the staff very friendly. I am definitely coming back to try more dishes. Arigato!

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Solo discrimination - Initially I booked a table for 3 and I called for a quantity change to 1p due to last minute cancellation. First reaction on the phone is that I will be moved to the counter because I am alone. No apologies nor an …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text:
Attire: jeans and shirt. Nothing fancy. Your clothes will smell of smoke

Food: order all the grilled skewers. But the beef tongue and the pork belly …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Food made with care and very authentic.  I ordered soba noodles, sashimi platter with otoro, some juicy grilled skewers and ochasuke. …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: The food at Hakata Senpachi is some of the best Japanese food I’ve had in Amsterdam. Service was friendly (maybe not the fastest) and it got pretty smokey from the grill, but the food was well worth it.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text:
Love this place. Grill mackerel is so good, I alone can eat at least 2.

Also there is a wide variety of plum wine selection.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Excellent service, great food, and not expensive. I'd definitely recommend this place, well above the other Japanese restaurants in the area. Other people commented that it's smokey inside, but I didn't find that.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Very bad experience today compared with previously visiting. Fish is not fresh, and grill is over cooked. Asked napkin, but they forgot to give us. Inside environment is not health with lots of smoke. Waiter is not customer focus, and not polite. Not recmend people come.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Real authentic Japanese food at a casual price and wide selection of Sake chosen by the master chef Hiro.  Restaurant is owned and managed by Japanese so you can feel you are in Hakata, southern city of Japan, once you step inside.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: This is definitely my favourite authentic Japanese restaurant in Amsterdam. It has an Izakaya vibe, which I really like and sometimes it even felt like I was in Japan again! …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: There's nothing like Senpachi anywhere in Europe, as far as I know. It's an izakaya the way you would find them among the best ones in Japan. …

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Came here for ramen but it's more like an izakaya - Japanese bar. Very nice food. Sashimi excellent. Yakatori very nice. Very cold beer. 🍺

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: The food was decent but the service was atrocious! 45 mins to receive our order while other patrons that came a lot later than us, and were incidentally Japanese men, were served significantly before us.  Mixed up our order as well, more than once we did not receive the dishes we ordered. Would not recommend this place to people who

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Was recommended to this place by a colleague and must say it did not disappoint. Had the weekend ramen lunch and it was excellent. Broth was rich and excellent when combined with the ramen. A true east in the west, will have to come back for their yakitori dinner

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text:
The best Tonkotsu ramen I've ever eaten in country other than Japan.
Basically Tonkotsu ramens in the overseas don't have Umami in the soup but this ramen has and they use good quality noodles.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Excellent Ramen. Just like we had in Kyoto couple of years back. It’s an authentic Japanese restaurant.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Pricey, the yakitori was good though.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text:
This is one of my favorite restaurants in Amsterdam. Delicious food. Try the skewered chicken skin.
Reservations are good idea, as this place gets busy.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: I have been going to this place for many years. Unfortunately the portions seem to become smaller every month, and the service level isn’t that good anymore. Only when the ‘older’ lady is working the service is outstanding.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Great place bit Smokey an bit of a long wait but overall excellent food

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Ordered yesterday. Unbelievably good, even the salads. Made with love, patience and knowhow. Highly recommended.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: So authentic! Rich flavour ramen. Just one of the best restaurant in Amsterdam.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Every dish was well-prepared. Loved the food. Ate too many dishes because I wanted to try more so it got a bit expensive. But worth it!

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: My favorite Japanese restaurant in Amsterdam. Very popular with Japanese  expats. Senpachi specialises in grilled dishes so don't expect any sushi.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: I enjoy the visit because it reminded me that I was back in Japan as I could speak Japanese with some of the staff. Felt really nice and nostalgic. Food was good.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: My favorite Japanese izakaya (pub). They grill their skewers to order, and their selection of sake/Japanese beers is top notch! Make a reservation for Fridays and weekends.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: A hidden gem in Amsterdam, a real ‘chefs like to eat place’. From the excellent approach to cooking on a open charcoal grill, through to the authentic drinks or weekend ramen.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: The pork belly and chicken yakitori sticks were DIVINE. I’ll be back very soon! One of my favourite restaurants! Delicious

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Authentic Japanese food! The smoke inside can be a little bit intense, but the delicious food and the super friendly service compensate for it! Will definitely be back!

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text:
Ordered a lot of different dishes from the menu and all of them were outstandingly delicious.
Surely coming back soon

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Good food, the fried chicken was a large portion!

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Amazing sticks and vegetables! Good for small bites. If you go for diner it can easily add up with all the small dishes.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Authentic food and great service. Price is super reasonable but the the stomach, tongue, miso pork were chewy unfortunately

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Hakata Senpachi is the best izakaya I have been able to find in Amsterdam, by a long shot. Their yakitori/kushi is amazing. A bit on the expensive side, but that's part of the course in Amsterdam.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: I've eaten here somewhere between 5-10 times and it's the go to place for yakitori in Amsterdam. Informal and authentically Japanese.

Name: Hakata Senpachi
Review Text: Very tasty dishes but to much smoke

Name: Hakata Senpachi
